intro: Eriogonum fusiforme, commonly known as the slender globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert environments. It has small, palmate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Eriogonum fusiforme is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
